messages.message: The copy on the sample apps has some errors/inconsistencies. I’ve put some suggested edits in the comments.

*Income Verification*

Extract income information from US income documents.

*US Paystubs*

Extract income information from paystubs from any US provider.

*Doc Summarization*

Summarize a document.

*Identity Verification*

Extract information from [international/US] passports or driver licenses. _[Clarify if there are any limitations, e.g. can this app do international driver licenses unlike the Driver License app. It’s also not super clear to me how this differs from using the Passport or Driver License apps]_

*US Bank Statements*

Extract transaction and balance information from bank statements from any US bank.

*[US] Driver License*

Extract information from a driver license from any US state.

*Passport*

Extract identity information from any international passport.

*US Tax Form W-2*

Extract information from the Form W-2 US tax form. _[Form W-2 seems to be the IRS official name, not W2 or W2 form]_
General feedback is to use consistent capitalization and spelling, use punctuation, and clarify US vs international limitations.

(To nitpick myself, I don’t think there’s a super consistent answer on if it’s “driver’s license” or “driver license”---looking at US government websites it varies from state to state, but driver license seems most common.)

Similarly I’d go through and review the copy when you click through to a sample app, for each sample app. E.g. on the Identity Verification app the instructions are a bit unclear and have some errors.

• It’s a bit confusing to say “Accepted file types” when that phrasing most commonly (and elsewhere on the site) refers to actual file types like PDF/PNG/etc. 
• “Drivers license” > “driver license” (unnecessary capitalization and spelling should be driver’s license or driver license). 
Something like `"Upload your passport or driver license files, or try the app out using the sample files provided. Accepted file types include .png, .jpeg, .pdf."` would be clearer.
Thanks a lot @Rosie - we’re revising the app subtitles right now, so these suggestions are super timely!
Would you be interested in reviewing a future draft of all this copy before we go live for launch?
Great! We’ll take you up on that :slightly_smiling_face:
